game

Class Card

  • java.lang.Object
    • game.Card
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Card>

    public class Card
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Card>
    Represents a card with a rank and suit.
    Author:
    Andy Ding, Eric Chang, Samuel Zhou
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • isNine

        public boolean isNine()
        Returns:
        true if this card's rank is "NINE" or false otherwise

      • isSkip

        public boolean isSkip()
        Returns:
        true if this card is a skip (if this card's rank is "QUEEN") or false otherwise

      • isReverse

        public boolean isReverse()
        Returns:
        true if this card is a reverse (if this card's rank is "ACE") or false otherwise

      • canPlay

        public boolean canPlay(Card top,
                       java.lang.String suit)
        Returns whether this card can be played on top of the current top card.
        Parameters:
        top - the current top card
        suit - the suit chosen if the current top card's rank is "NINE"
        Returns:
        true if this card can be played on top of the current top card or false otherwise
